meanings.definition: A musical note having the time value of one sixty-fourth of a whole note.
meanings.sent1: During the concert, the pianist played a demisemiquaver that was so quick it sounded like a tiny chirp.
meanings.sent2: The sheet music was filled with demisemiquavers, requiring the violinist to play with great speed and precision.
meanings.sent3: The demisemiquaver danced across the music sheet, trying to keep up with the longer notes.
meanings.sent4: The demisemiquaver in the symphony was like a fleeting whisper in the wind, barely noticeable but adding depth to the melody.
meanings.sent5: As the conductor emphasized the demisemiquaver, the orchestra followed with delicate grace.

meanings.sent1: She practiced diligently to demisemiquaver the challenging piece, ensuring each note was clear and precise.
meanings.sent2: The choir members had to demisemiquaver in perfect harmony to create a beautiful musical performance.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside seemed to demisemiquaver along with the singer, adding a whimsical touch to the melody.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers moved swiftly on the piano keys, as if trying to demisemiquaver through a musical maze.
meanings.sent5: The singer's ability to demisemiquaver effortlessly amazed the audience, leaving them in awe of her talent.
